gov.nih.nlm.ling.io

Class XMLArgumentReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.io.XMLArgumentReader

  • public class XMLArgumentReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Reader for Argument elements of Relation objects. Each argument XML element is expected to have id and idref attributes, idref corresponding to the argument SemanticItem object. The name of the XML element is taken as the role of the argument.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu
    See Also:
    Argument

      Reads the arguments of the XML element el, which corresponds to the relation object and its children to arguments.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • readArguments

        public static java.util.List<Argument> readArguments(nu.xom.Element el,
                                                     Document doc,
                                                     java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ignoreArgTypes,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SemanticItem> equivMap)
        Reads the arguments of the XML element el, which corresponds to the relation object and its children to arguments. The arguments with a role in ignoreArgTypes will be ignored. If the argument id is a key in equivMap, the corresponding value in the map will be used, instead.
        Parameters:
        el - the XML element corresponding to the enclosing Relation object
        doc - the document associated with the semantic items
        ignoreArgTypes - the argument roles to ignore
        equivMap - the equivalence map between semantic items in the document
        Returns:
        the list of arguments for the enclosing Relation object
